This is an excellent romantic comedy that relies more on wit and character than on silly, typical formula. A lot of people I know walked away from this movie disappointed, but I found it an enjoyable experience. I also don't understand why Hollywood thinks that 'quirkiness' is more important than story, or why they can't seem to create movies in which the plot is interesting and makes sense.

I have seen both the first and second in this series but this is by far the best. Liam is very good as usual, and is developing a great rapport with the young Jennifer Carpenter. The twist at the end was terrific and the fight sequences at the end, just great! So glad that I don't have to suffer through another crapfest like
great sense of humour, the way how the movie begins and ends and the evolution of the plot
fails to create a real, lasting connection between its characters .
